div.p: Yours of the 25 May recd and the day before I got an answer from Sister Martha acknowledging the receipt of $100. She sent me a picture of HJacobs which is very like Mother and one of Richard and will send me hers soon - Dick arrived safe at Vera Cruz after a long passage and found his father thohis mother is near the city of Mexico in the same house she had when there before. I am sorry C is so unwell and do not know what to advise except daily cold bath and gall pills which I think will do him good Annie I hope is only bite which will soon yield to treatment I think you had better be

vaccinated as also the elder children. it may safe you from the small pox - I am well having got rid of my cold the weather is rather cooler but is summer here and will be a longe one - I cannot say yet if I can come home as I must wait and see what will be done about trade the lines are still closed and but few permits are granted but those few confine me to the office and having so little to do I think of you all until I am homesick if I cannot get away before the middle of this month I will send your sack by express and some music for Charlie - I hope you have sent the money to Alick for item insurance my guns are not insure so that in case of fire try to ours them and clothing. Will Charlie want

her to take the Gall pills if she will dip them in thick Tumaralic Muncilage and let them dry and redip them once or twice they will slip down easily - this is dyspeptic I am well and you know what good they did me I think you had better clean the house you have until I can get back fine with 2500 we can get a mini farm near Jonesborough - I wish I was in our old bed again for feather are two warm to sleep on this weather and I have not yet got a mattress waiting until I know what to do - Kiss all for me and let them all kiss you for me
